I am currently doing virology research at the Pekosz lab. I also worked as a research assistant for resposible science communication at the R3ISE center. For more information, please visit my profile page.

title: Sample Analysis: Whoâ€™s the most depressing shoegaze band?
text:
Shoegaze is a effect-heavy subgenre of indie rock.






Who is the most depressing shoegaze band?
Who is the most depressed lyricist?
Is shoegaze bands becoming happier/sadder over time?

title: Sample Analysis: Whoâ€™s the most depressing shoegaze band?
text:
Data Acquisition & Wragling

Data Acquisition
Lyrics from all studio albums of the â€˜big threeâ€™ bands in the shoegaze genre - my bloody valentine, Ride, and slowdive - are retrieved from Genius.com using a Python package named lyricsgenius based on Genius API. Please see the authorâ€™s instructions for details.
The downloaded .json files were written into a .csv file for further processing.


Data Cleaning
Here is a typical piece of lyrics retrieved directly from the website. It has some problems:

16 ContributorsBallad of Sister Sue Lyrics DonâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´t tell me IâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´m lost if I donâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´t seem too sure what to wear DonâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´t tell me IâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´m lost if I donâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´t seem too sure what to wear ThereâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´s a fire in my head and IâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´m blinded by all I canâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´t see ThereâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´s a fire in my head and IâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´m blinded by all I canâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´t see Dancing to nowhere, IâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´m losing my head among thieves Dancing to nowhere, IâˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´m losing my head among thieves And the man at the bar looked like all that he needed was gone And the man at the bar looked like all that he needed was gone Sister, Iâ€™ve lost all the feeling Iâ€™m lost and Iâ€™m sold I lay down beside you Sister, Iâ€™m blinded Itâ€™s only my eyes Iâ€™ve sold them before The man said the drink in his hand would be all he required The man said the drink in his hand would be all he required And it seemed much the same when he pointed the gun at his head And it seemed much the same when he pointed the gun at his head Filled it with lead It made so much noise that I checked out of town, yeah Blood on my face and the words of a sage in my mind (It made so much noise that I checked out of town, yeah) See Slowdive LiveGet tickets as low as $55You might also like Sister, Iâ€™ve lost all the feeling Iâ€™m lost and Iâ€™m sold I lay down beside you Sister, Iâ€™m blinded Itâ€™s only my eyes Iâ€™ve sold them before6Embed


â€˜16 ContributorsBallad of Sister Sue Lyricsâ€™ at the beginning and â€˜6Embedâ€™ at the end are not part of the lyrics.
â€˜âˆšÂ¢Â¬Ã„Â¬Ã´â€™ - some problem with Unicode encoding/decoding.
â€˜See Slowdive LiveGet tickets as low as $55â€™ - ads is also not part of the lyrics.


library('stringi')
library('tidyverse')
library('tidytext')
library('lubridate')

# import data
lyrics <- read.csv("lyrics_data.csv")

# clean text
lyrics_clean <- lyrics %>%
  mutate(Lyrics = stri_enc_toutf8(Lyrics)) %>%
  mutate(Lyrics = str_replace_all(Lyrics, 'Ã¢\u0080\u0099', "'")) %>%
  mutate(Lyrics = Lyrics %>%
           str_remove(".*Lyrics") %>%
           str_remove("See.*tickets as low as \\$\\d+") %>%
           str_remove('You might also like') %>%
           str_remove('\\d*\\s*Embed$') %>%
           str_trim()) %>%
  filter(!str_detect(Lyrics, "^\\s*$")) %>% # remove instrumental
  mutate(Release.Date = dmy(Release.Date)) # set date using lubridate

It now gives a clear output -

Donâ€™t tell me Iâ€™m lost if I donâ€™t seem too sure what to wear Donâ€™t tell me Iâ€™m lost if I donâ€™t seem too sure what to wear Thereâ€™s a fire in my head and Iâ€™m blinded by all I canâ€™t see Thereâ€™s a fire in my head and Iâ€™m blinded by all I canâ€™t see Dancing to nowhere, Iâ€™m losing my head among thieves Dancing to nowhere, Iâ€™m losing my head among thieves And the man at the bar looked like all that he needed was gone And the man at the bar looked like all that he needed was gone Sister, Iâ€™ve lost all the feeling Iâ€™m lost and Iâ€™m sold I lay down beside you Sister, Iâ€™m blinded Itâ€™s only my eyes Iâ€™ve sold them before The man said the drink in his hand would be all he required The man said the drink in his hand would be all he required And it seemed much the same when he pointed the gun at his head And it seemed much the same when he pointed the gun at his head Filled it with lead It made so much noise that I checked out of town, yeah Blood on my face and the words of a sage in my mind (It made so much noise that I checked out of town, yeah) Sister, Iâ€™ve lost all the feeling Iâ€™m lost and Iâ€™m sold I lay down beside you Sister, Iâ€™m blinded Itâ€™s only my eyes Iâ€™ve sold them before


# text analysis
token <- lyrics_clean %>%
  unnest_tokens(output = Word, 
                input = Lyrics, 
                token = 'words')

# stopwords dropped
token_clean <- token %>%
  anti_join(stop_words, by = c("Word" = "word"))

# make a word cloud
library('wordcloud')
token_count <- token_clean %>%
  group_by(Artist) %>%
  count(Word, name = 'Word_count', sort = TRUE)

token_count_head <- token_count %>%
  group_by(Artist) %>%
  slice(1:40) %>%
  mutate(Word = fct_reorder(Word, Word_count, .desc = FALSE))

library(ggplot2)
library(ggwordcloud)
palette <- c("my bloody valentine" = "#DC143C",
                   "Ride" = "#1569C2",
                   "Slowdive" = "#CCBA16")

token_count_head %>%
  ggplot(aes(label = Word, size = Word_count, color = Artist)) + 
  geom_text_wordcloud(word.ratio = 0.2, # adjust for overall word size
                      max_size = 30) +
  facet_wrap(~Artist) +
  scale_color_manual(values = palette)
